briefTitle: Self-Administered Lidocaine Gel for Pain Management With First Trimester Surgical Abortion: A Randomized Controlled Trial

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion criteria:

* Women ages 18 and older undergoing elective surgical abortion at 5 and 0/7 to 11 and 6/7 weeks gestational age
* Use of IV sedation for pain management
* English or Spanish speaking
* Ability to give informed consent

Exclusion criteria:

* Any pre-operative use of misoprostol (typically given at 12 weeks and above in this clinic)
* Allergy to study medications: lidocaine, midazolam, fentanyl
* Known uterine anomaly
* Prior cervical surgery.

outcomeMeasures.title: Difference in Pain Level at Time of Cervical Dilation as Measured by a Visual Analog Scale
outcomeMeasures.description: This is the amount of pain self-reported by the patient at the time of cervical dilation. VAS ranged from 0 to 100 mm, 0 equals no pain, 100 equals worse pain imaginable.

outcomeMeasures.title: Pain Level Prior to Procedure (Anticipated Pain) as Measured by a Visual Analog Scale
outcomeMeasures.description: This is the amount of pain self-reported by the patient prior to the procedure (Anticipated pain). VAS ranged from 0 to 100 mm, 0 equals no pain, 100 equals worse pain imaginable.

outcomeMeasures.title: Pain With Speculum Insertion as Measured by a Visual Analog Scale
outcomeMeasures.description: This is the amount of pain self-reported by the patient at the time of speculum insertion. VAS ranged from 0 to 100 mm, 0 equals no pain, 100 equals worse pain imaginable.

outcomeMeasures.title: Pain With Tenaculum Placement as Measured by a Visual Analog Scale
outcomeMeasures.description: This is the amount of pain self-reported by the patient at the time of tenaculum placement. VAS ranged from 0 to 100 mm, 0 equals no pain, 100 equals worse pain imaginable.

outcomeMeasures.title: Pain 30-45 Minutes After Procedure as Measured by a Visual Analog Scale
outcomeMeasures.description: This is the amount of pain self-reported by the patient 30-45 minutes after procedure. VAS ranged from 0 to 100 mm, 0 equals no pain, 100 equals worse pain imaginable.

outcomeMeasures.title: Overall Satisfaction With Procedure as Measured by a Visual Analog Scale
outcomeMeasures.description: This is the level of overall satisfaction self-reported by the patient at the completion of the procedure and prior to discharge. VAS ranged from 0 to 100 mm, 0 equals not satisfied, 100 equals highest satisfaction possible.

outcomeMeasures.title: Overall Complication Rate as Measured by a Count of Participants in Each Group
